channel.title: Bases that actually can be used as melodies
channel.description:
Yes, there are a few, believe it or not. Some basses, on high notes, can sound like normal leads. Now I'm not gonna talk about the disgusting ones, like Freak(nasty)(bad bass ever), but I'll focus on the more applicable ones. Let's start with Bee. You hear Bee in a lot of DeCruz's earlier songs, and it can be used to create a bright and uplifting feel when paired with a lead sound like Mist. The bee should use high notes. Don't use Bee in darker songs, as it doesn't fit as well.
Basically none of the ones from Vivrant work well, but 7 Skies is where it gets interesting.
Cube makes for a great pluck lead, you can hear it in the drop of Akyut's BTC#14. Pepper also has an interesting pluck sound. Basically if you want a weird, thick(with 2 c's amirite) sounding pluck lead, go for 7 Skies. Just try it. P.S. Must be using high notes. Low and mid range notes won't work as well at all. RAC is very similar to 7 Skies. Cool leads.
Now for the Future. Basically all of these are great, but some shine above the rest. I used Lobster as a lead in my song Bluetown. Lizard is a great one also, as it can create this happy moving feel. You can hear it in HAYW1R3's song H M M. Lots of the other songs create really cheerful sounds, so don't use them for dark and moving songs. I hate to say it, but they create a very "Owl City-ish sound".
That's basically it, did I miss any?
